body.p: Tapestry is a community project, and now follows the Apache Software Foundation meritocracy rules to guide its future development. Tapestry Developers plan features, discuss and vote on the Tapestry Developers' Mailing List.
The following are the current Tapestry committers.

section.title: Mind Bridge
section.p: Mind Bridge has been a long term contributor to Tapestry, and is the creator of the invaluable Table component.

section.title: Paul Ferraro
section.p: Paul has been an avid Tapestry user since 2002, and created the original friendly URLs patch for Tapestry 3.0. He's responsible for the new and improved validation subsystem.

section.title: Erik Hatcher
section.p: Erik began by contributing Javadoc fixes (flagged by IDEA) as he was learning Tapestry. He has added the OGNL type converter facility for expression bindings and is active in making the Table component easy to use.

section.title: Harish Krishnaswamy
section.p: Harish is a Tapestry enthusiast and is also becoming a HiveMind enthusiast.

section.title: Richard Lewis-Shell
section.p: Richard is one of the real early adopters of Tapestry.

section.title: Howard Lewis Ship
section.p: Howard started the Tapestry project in early 2000 and guides its development and evolution.

section.title: Geoff Longman
section.p: Geoff has advanced Tapestry light years with his excellent Eclipse plug-in, Spindle.

section.title: David Solis
section.p: David is another long-term user, and has added a suite of WML components to the framework.

section.title: Jesse Kuhnert
section.p: Jesse initially cut his teeth working on a component project for tapestry called Tacos. He is currently working on ajax specfic features in tapestry, as well as wherever else he can.
